reviewText: This will not play on a newer computer. It would not play on my Vista machine with either my LG DVD writer or my Sony Blu-Ray player, due to the hardware anti-copy provisions. It will play on my XP machine, but only in my older DVD player, not my LG DVD burner. The DVD player is old enough to not have those damned restrictions.NOTE: I finally switched my older machine to Ubuntu Linux, with the same results.The video quality is excellent, equal to commercial DVDs. The disk art and packaging are as good as commercial DVDs as well. And the show itself is great, very funny and good-natured. Well worth buying, I hope enough people do that Amazon releases the rest of the episodes.
Title: Ned’s Declassified School Survival Guide – The Best of Season 2

reviewText: Ned's is one of my favorite shows, and i've already watched this season two set 3 times in the past month. the set comes with the entire season two and the episode quality is very nice.
Title: Ned’s Declassified School Survival Guide – The Best of Season 2

reviewText: This is great upbeat and clever show - kids will love it - and so will adults. My family loves to watch this show - it has a positive message, that kids can overcome their challenges, and it's portrayed in a funny way they'll appreciate!
Title: Ned’s Declassified School Survival Guide – The Best of Season 2

reviewText: this is one of those shows you cant explain. its probally intended for 10-14 year olds based on the casts age, and grade. but people that grew up with the show will probally like it into adulthood. sure it gives tips for school, but it really doesnt push them at you. this wasnt released in the u.s so the copies from canada for $15(2012) is a good deal they were $25(2010) but when more get sold, prices will go up. dont get the best of, get the whole season, dont forget to get season 1 too. the episdoes can or may not be connected in some ways.to give you an idea of how the show is, tunneling through the school to conqour you emotions, and getting roped down to steal stuff, and getting advice from a janitor, who gets threatened almost everyday to clean stuff. this might sound bad, but this show is really cleen, and for those who are worried it might be bad for there kids, the worse thing that happens in the whole series is a person ends up in his underwear behind a sign for 3 seconds. the show is really funny, and has many strange school rituals, some true, some untrue, and the sound effects when things fall, and people get confused ect. are really good. one episode they let a frog go, and it exploded, but then they realize it was a can of vegetables, but there playing happy music, and it stops all of a sudden.
summary: great tv show, if you didnt grow up with it you might not like it.
Title: Ned’s Declassified School Survival Guide – The Best of Season 2

reviewText: This show was one of Nickelodeon's best. Very funny and unlike some NICK shows today it was completely age appropriate and had nothing that made parents cringe. Season 2 of Ned's Declassified aired from 2005-2006 and followed Ned and his friends through their 7th grade year in middle school. Just a fun show to watch; filled with wacky and wild antics and some pretty useful tips for kids in middle school as well. This is actually the complete 2nd season(not one of Amazon's "best of" DVDs) but it was released only in Canada(along with Seasons 2 and 3 of Zoey 101) but now a few copies are making their way into the United States. Disappointing that Nick cancelled this show after just 3 seasons but thanks to a DVD company in Canada the entire series is available on DVD.
Title: Ned’s Declassified School Survival Guide – The Best of Season 2
